definition: to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: Was this a lover, or a lecher whether?
sentences.chinese: 誰知這究竟是戀愛，還是瞎胡鬧？

sentences.english: Stop pissing about. I've got work to do.
sentences.chinese: 別胡鬧了，我還有活要幹。

sentences.english: In the age of the farce, the choice can be made a lovely children.
sentences.chinese: 在可以胡鬧的年齡，選擇做了一個乖孩子。

sentences.english: If you behave so foolishly you must be ready to take the consequences.
sentences.chinese: 假如你這樣瞎胡鬧，就應該準備自食其果。

sentences.english: After school some students are horsing around in the park.
sentences.chinese: 放學後，一些學生在公園裏胡鬧。

sentences.english: "Idiotic?" Natalie said. "I was just deciding it's rather magical.
sentences.chinese: “瞎胡鬧？”娜塔麗說，“我正覺得有點神奇呢。”

sentences.english: That boy is seldom serious about anything. He's sll the time clowning around.
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩對任何事件都不認真，他總是胡鬧。

sentences.english: You have been raking and smoking too much, you wicked boy.
sentences.chinese: 你成天胡鬧，吸菸吸得太多了，你這個淘氣的孩子。

sentences.english: That man is seldom serious acres anything. He's sll the time clhaveing by oneself.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩對任何事件都不認真，他總是胡鬧。

sentences.english: He told the boys to quit their monkey business，or he would call a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴那些男孩子不要再胡鬧，不然他就叫老師。

sentences.english: Stop larking about and get on with your work.
sentences.chinese: 別到處胡鬧了，幹活去吧。

sentences.english: These dissipations make against your chance of success.
sentences.chinese: 你這樣胡鬧下去，就很難有所成就了。

sentences.english: Were you serious, or was that a bit of tomfoolery?
sentences.chinese: 你是認真的呢，還是有點胡鬧？

sentences.english: They are not working;they are just assing about.
You boys have been horsing about again, getting yourselves dirty.
sentences.chinese: 你們這些男孩們又在胡鬧，把身上都弄髒了。

sentences.english: The prank went undetected around the world.
sentences.chinese: 全世界都沒察覺這場胡鬧。

definition: to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to look for trouble
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to turn a blind eye
pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

definition: noisy/raucous/to shout and scream
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
unpleasant talk/malicious words
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
